mission_data.mission_description: The newly restored TSN Diana is now returning to active service in the war against the Arvonian/Torgoth alliance. The Artemis and Diana are sent back into enemy territory, on a mission to try to break up the enemy alliance.^^This mission is a sequel to "The Diana Operation 2".

big_message.title: The Diana Operation III: Return to Elysia
big_message.subtitle2: An adventure for one or two ships for Artemis 2.7

event.name: All Player Ships Destroyed

log.text: FAILED because all player ships destroyed

big_message.title: MISSION FAILED
big_message.subtitle1: All player ships have been destroyed

event.incoming_comms_text: Mission Failed^All player ships have been destroyed

event.name: All enemies destroyed
event.incoming_comms_text: Good work! The Torgoths have been defeated and the Arvonians are retreating. It looks like the war will soon be over! Congratulations!

event.name: All Bases Destroyed

log.text: FAILED because all player bases destroyed

big_message.title: MISSION FAILED
big_message.subtitle1: All player bases have been destroyed

event.incoming_comms_text: Mission Failed^All player bases have been destroyed

log.text: Diana spawned as a non-Light Cruiser

warning_popup_message.message: Diana must be a Light Cruiser

event.name: Tell Diana about cloaking device
event.incoming_comms_text: Diana bridge, the Skaraan cloaking device is now ready for operation. When enabled, we will be invisible to enemies farther away than 3000m. The cloaking field will show on allied ship sensors as a purple circle. Any movement or any firing of missiles will automatically cause the cloaking device to disengage. Once disengaged, the cloaking device requires a cooldown time of 10 seconds before it can be re-engaged.

folder_arme.name: Task: Diana to dock with Houston Outpost

event.name: TSN Command summons Diana
event.incoming_comms_text: Diana, please dock at Houston Outpost immediately to receive new mission orders.

event.name: TSN Command summons Diana again
event.incoming_comms_text: Diana, we repeat, you are instructed to dock at Houston Outpost immediately to receive new mission orders!

event.name: GM summons Diana again
event.incoming_comms_text: Diana, We repeat, you are instructed to dock at Houston Outpost immediately to receive new mission orders!

log.text: Houston Outpost issued mission orders to Diana

event.name: Houston Outpost gives instruction 1
event.incoming_comms_text: Two years ago, TSN researchers began formulating a plan to try to break up the Arvonian/Torgoth alliance, with whom the TSN has been at war for years. This plan relied on constructing a device that was merely theoretical at the time, and to fully design and develop would require large amounts of a rare mineral known as Cetrocite, and so the Diana was sent on a secret mission into enemy territory to a planet that probes indicated had virtually unlimited deposits of Cetrocite.

event.name: Houston Outpost gives instruction 2
event.incoming_comms_text: However, the mission failed when both the Diana and the planet suddenly vanished into a newly appeared wormhole, which then disappeared as quickly as it appeared. Months laster, the wormhole reopened and an Artemis Away Team took a shuttle into the wormhole and recovered the crippled Diana from the planet Elysia still inside the wormhole, and returned the Diana to TSN space, after discovering that generations had passed on Elysia due to the time differential inside.

event.name: Houston Outpost gives instruction 3
event.incoming_comms_text: Repairs on the heavily damaged Diana continued for many months, until its computer banks were finally fully restored, whereupon it was discovered that it had been infected with an Arvonian AI that had been dormant in damaged memory banks and had been reawakened when the memory was repaired. The AI was eventually neutralized and interrogated.

event.name: Houston Outpost gives instruction 4
event.incoming_comms_text: We have now learned that the AI originated from a mainframe on Elysia and had infected the Diana when the Diana began scanning the planet. For its secret mission into enemy space, the Diana had been outfitted with an experimental cloaking device, cobbled together from parts salvaged from a Skaraan wreck. The AI had attempted to sabotage this device, but in so doing caused the Diana to crash on the planet and much of the computer record was lost as a result.

event.name: Houston Outpost gives instruction 5
event.incoming_comms_text: Now that the Diana is restored to normal operation and scientists predict another opening of the wormhole is imminent, we must resume the original mission. The Artemis must defend TSN space while the Diana heads back to Elysia to retrieve a cargo of Cetrocite, and investigate the mainframe. If the mainframe contains a record of the plan to break up the enemy alliance, it is critical that the records be deleted or the mainframe destroyed to prevent Arvonian command from learning of the plan.

event.name: Mission Failed - Houston Outpost Destroyed

log.text: Houston Outpost destroyed before giving orders to Diana

event.incoming_comms_text: Houston Outpost was destroyed!

folder_arme.name: Task: Artemis to dock with SB01 to get beacons

event.name: TSN Command summons Artemis
event.incoming_comms_text: Artemis, please dock at SB01 immediately to receive new mission orders.

event.name: TSN Command summons Artemis again
event.incoming_comms_text: Artemis, we repeat, you are instructed to dock at SB01 immediately to receive new mission orders!

event.name: GM summons Artemis again
event.incoming_comms_text: Artemis, We repeat, you are instructed to dock at Houston Outpost immediately to receive new mission orders!

log.text: SB01 issued mission orders to Artemis

event.name: SB01 gives instruction
event.incoming_comms_text: Artemis, we have retrofitted your shuttle bay with an experimental holographic beacon deployment system. Beacons deployed by this experimental system will generate holographic signals that will appear to sensors and viewscreens as if they were space whales. Intelligence indicates that all Arvonians will attempt to steer clear of space whales by at least 5000m, while Torgoths are known to actively hunt them down if within 5000m, even in preference to attacking our ships. It is hoped that, if you use them intelligently, these can give you key tactical advantages. Your Comms officer can direct them to be deployed out your rear shuttle bay door, similar to mines.

event.name: Mission Failed - SB01 Destroyed

log.text: SB01 destroyed before giving Artemis orders

event.incoming_comms_text: SB01 was destroyed!

warning_popup_message.message: Artemis: Gravity well hazard. Proceed cautiously.

event.name: Collision Alert
event.incoming_comms_text: Artemis bridge, analysis indicates that our ship can NOT withstand the forces of the wormhole. We recommend leaving the area immediately!

warning_popup_message.message: Artemis was destroyed by the wormhole!
warning_popup_message.name: Artemis

warning_popup_message.message: Diana: Gravity well hazard. Proceed cautiously.

event.name: Collision Alert
event.incoming_comms_text: Diana bridge, analysis indicates that our ship can safely navigate through the wormhole.

warning_popup_message.message: Diana has entered the wormhole. Gravity is normal.
warning_popup_message.name: Diana

warning_popup_message.message: The Diana has entered the wormhole.
Diana: Gravity well hazard. Proceed cautiously.
The Diana has exited the wormhole.
Diana: Gravity well hazard. Proceed cautiously.
The Diana has re-entered the wormhole!
The Diana has re-entered the wormhole!

log.text: Destroying phantom whale beacause beacon |firstnumber| destroyed
Scheduling destroying beacon beacause phantom whale |firstnumber| was destroyed

event.name: Change Diana side for "Engage Cloak" button
Break up alliance
event.incoming_comms_text: Because the traitorous Torgoths have ruthlessly destroyed the innocent whale Pha|secondnumber|, we refuse to further participate in an alliance with those infidels! Let us destroy them!
